other_tests.findings: Severe blepharitis with mucopurulent discharge, epiphoria, absent Meibomian glands in both eyes. Cycloplegic refraction: +6.25/-2x180° (right eye), +6.75/-2x10 (left eye), best-corrected visual acuity of 20/200 in both eyes. Schirmer test with anesthetics was normal. Mean fluorescein tear-film break-up time: 4 seconds (right eye), 5 seconds (left eye), indicating rapid tear evaporation. Anterior segment: bilateral superficial punctuate keratitis. Fundoscopy: unremarkable in both eyes.
Bilateral severely reduced cone responses consistent with congenital cone dystrophy.
Normal, suggesting early stage of the disease.

Two pathogenic variants: c.931A > G (p.Ser311Gly) in the TP63 gene (de novo) and c.1810C > T (p.Arg604Ter) in the CNGB3 gene (homozygous inherited from heterozygous parents). Proband’s sister was homozygous for the same CNGB3 variant.
